content.en: Pathogen detection revolution: Scientists are using algorithms to answer important questions about identifying organisms, detecting pathogens, and designing diagnostic assays. These algorithms are able to generate probe sequences, compare hybridization patterns, filter DNA sequences, and predict base calls. By harnessing the power of computational methods, researchers are able to develop high-throughput pipelines and web-based platforms for pathogen detection and characterization. These advancements in informatics, bioinformatics, and genomics are allowing for comprehensive and rapid surveillance of pathogens, which has applications in clinical diagnostics, food safety testing, and environmental monitoring.
content.da: Patogendetektion revolution: Forskere bruger algoritmer til at besvare vigtige spørgsmål om identificering af organismer, detektion af patogener og design af diagnostiske tests. Disse algoritmer er i stand til at generere probesekvenser, sammenligne hybridiseringsmønstre, filtrere DNA-sekvenser og forudsige base calls. Ved at udnytte kraften i computermetoder kan forskere udvikle højkapacitets pipelines og webbaserede platforme til patogendetektion og karakterisering. Disse fremskridt inden for informatik, bioinformatik og genomik muliggør omfattende og hurtig overvågning af patogener, hvilket har anvendelser inden for klinisk diagnostik, fødevaresikkerhedstestning og miljøovervågning.
